text:
Thank arrigo, it's my fault. Resolved.
One question : if i'm using graphql queries with cms-js-rendering ( in server-side of course )  i have the token limits or can I be comfortable? <@U01QVR44MEY>

The GraphQL limits when you are exporting the query from the module and pulling from `props.dataQueryResult` are the same as the limits when associating a query with a template as seen here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages>
i don't see in this link the limits byron
<@UAYBXDG4U> thank you for your response
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql#query-complexity-and-account-limits>

I should add that while in development, the local dev server is actually making use of the public `collector/graphql` endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql#use-a-graphql-query-in-an-api-request>

This means that your local queries will count differently relative to limits. That said we do cache GraphQL responses in the dev server based on the query itself. i.e.
So ... if i'm using graphql in prod ( server side rendering query mode , so i'm not using api requests ) i have the limit of 500k tokens per minute? just to clarify  <@UAYBXDG4U>
Correct.
thanks byron
Ah, I mis-spoke ... the 429 would only occur when directly hitting the external GraphQL API endpoint
So by doing this, I won't have issues with too many requests and points?
I'm digging on what the limits/fallback is for queries bound to modules/templates.
Thank you so much, <@UAYBXDG4U>. I need to do an important integration and I wanted to rely on GraphQL, so it's vital to know these things and how to handle too many requests if they occur.
Completely understand, I'll get that limit information asap
thank you so much again.
The rolling limit of 500,000 points per minute does not apply to the bound queries.
Though, you are still restricted by the individual query max of 30,000 points.
great !! That's what I wanted to hear, thanks again .

Guys what is this problem id? :
9cb257a2-050b-4757-97b4-72c2bffda2da
maybe for CSS Modules Stylesheet?
Yes, the problem is that I was using CSS with a stylesheet module, importing the style and using className={style.example}. It would be nice to be able to use them.
Is there an issue with the build server this morning? Iâ€™m suddenly getting these failure messages when I try to deploy:

Hi <@UAYBXDG4U>, since you guys are talking about this, is it possible to create dynamic pages with the GraphQL implementation in React as well? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/use-graphql-data-in-your-website-pages> I haven't been able to test this but I have a use case that I need to work on soon (creating multiple pages based on contact records) and it would be great if it could be done directly from the JS blocks :slightly_smiling_face:

There is an intermittent issue with builds currently that we are looking to fix today
Trying to build again should eventually lead to a success in the meantime
This should be available
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-js-building-block-examples/blob/main/styling/styling-project/styling-app/components/partials/CSSModulesPartial.jsx>
<@U044BTK3EGP> I'm not entirely sure what you are asking here. Can you be more specific in terms of how you are envisioning this working?

<@UAYBXDG4U> sure, in the "Create dynamic pages using query data" section in the documentation that I shared, it says that you can create dynamic pages based on CRM data with their unique slugs.

My use case is creating multiple landing pages in a short amount of time that are fully-personalized to a prospect in the database, so with their company name, industry, pain points, etc.

Let's say I want to create 20 pages like that with CRM data using GraphQL. I'm trying to understand if this can be achieved with React modules.

Honestly I'm new to GraphQL so I might be asking stupid questions but I'm struggling to understand how to use these directives:

web_page_canonical_url
web_page_featured_image
web_page_meta_description
web_page_title

... to create the dynamic pages, and if it can be done on the React or if it has to be done on the theme side :slightly_smiling_face: I'll test this out in a few days but just thought I'd ask beforehand.

Sorry for the confusion.
very strange that the comment fixed it for at least `moduleStory`

youâ€™re right that `moduleStoryWithIsland` will be more complicated - i could see simpler cases where the decorator would be fine outside the iframeâ€¦and at least in the case of CMS modules i would maybe recommend structuring styling for them to not depend on higher up CSS. the idea being that they should be fairly portable and drag-and-drop-able by marketers within any given page. is that a fair push?
